intro: Sisymbrium karataviense, commonly known as the Karatavinsk yarrow, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, characterized by its low-growing habit and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces slender, elongated pods that contain small, rounded seeds. Due to its habitat and morphology, it is often found in rocky or sandy soils, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native range.
